episode: My best friend is on hospice.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm having a really bad day. My best friend just got put on hospice.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm so sorry to hear that. That's really tough.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes. She didn't want to do chemo so the doctors said she only has a couple of weeks at most.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That must be devastating for you. Are you spending time with her?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: As much as I can. I'm trying to get leave from work approved. I'm not really good for anything right now.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Take care of yourself too, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm trying. I can't stop crying though. And I know it's not good to let her see me cry so much. She doesn't need that.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's hard to stay strong for her when you're hurting too.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm devastated. She is my only close chick friend. We do everything together.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It sounds like you two are more like sisters.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes. She's twenty years older than me but we act just like twins.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really special. Age didn't matter to your friendship.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Not at all. She always includes me in all her family events.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: She must consider you family, not just a friend.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes. I am so scared and sad right now. I don't know what I'm gonna do.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I can feel your pain. It's okay to be scared and sad.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Death is never easy for me. I usually go into a deep depression when these things happen. It's only gotten worse as I get older...

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's like the losses pile up and get harder to bear.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes. It also reminds you that nearly everything in life causes cancer.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's scary how many things can trigger it.
